page.title: 13Finningley village-buildings
page.content: Housing: Only a small number of the buildings in Finningley village today were built before the 20th century.Many were farm buildings.Most of them have been converted into residential properties. Building just before and after the 2nd World War almost doubled the size of the village, and its character was changed,from being a rural community, where just about everybody worked on the land, to being a place where people lived whilst working in the surrounding towns and villages. During the last 15 years the village has again doubled in size, with the building of many small estates of houses,three of which are currently being further developed. Other services: Several shops: a grocers,a newsagent & a garage.A riding school is also here.
